sect1.title: helios::engine::runtime::pooling
sect1.para: GameObject pooling for efficient object recycling.

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: This module provides infrastructure for memory-efficient entity management through object pooling. Pools pre-allocate GameObjects that can be acquired and released during gameplay, avoiding repeated allocation overhead.

entry.para: Container holding pre-allocated GameObject identifiers with O(1) acquire/release
Configuration data for pool initialization (ID, prefab, size)
High-level manager for pool lifecycle and acquire/release operations
Central registry mapping pool IDs to pool instances
Read-only snapshot of pool state (active/inactive counts)

sect1.title: Architecture
sect1.para: The pooling system follows a layered architecture:

1. GameObjectPool: Low-level GUID tracking (active/inactive lists) 2. GameObjectPoolRegistry: Pool lookup by typed ID 3. GameObjectPoolManager: Integration with GameWorld for prefab cloning and entity lookup 4. GameObjectPoolConfig: Declarative pool configuration
Spawn/despawn request handling has been moved to helios::engine::runtime::spawn.
